intro: Chaerophyllum rubellum, commonly known as redstem mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny white or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat diversity.
